Title.evidence: Data from a multicentre, double-blind, randomized placebo-controlled superiority trial were used.

Trial_Design.evidence: Patients scheduled for laparoscopic RYGB or sleeve gastrectomy were randomized to receive 900 mg UDCA or placebo for 6 months.

Participants.evidence: Patients scheduled for laparoscopic RYGB or sleeve gastrectomy were randomized.

Intervention.evidence: Patients scheduled for laparoscopic RYGB or sleeve gastrectomy were randomized to receive 900 mg UDCA or placebo for 6 months.

Objective.evidence: The aim was to evaluate the cost-effectiveness and cost–utility of ursodeoxycholic acid (UDCA) prophylaxis for the prevention of symptomatic gallstone disease after Roux-en- Y gastric bypass (RYGB) in patients without gallstones before surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Main outcomes were the costs per patient free from symptomatic gallstone disease and the costs per quality-adjusted life-year (QALY).

Blinding.evidence: Data from a multicentre, double-blind, randomized placebo-controlled superiority trial were used.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Patients receiving UDCA prophylaxis were more likely to remain free from symptomatic gallstone disease (relative risk 1.06, 95 per cent c.i. 1.02 to 1.11; P = 0.002) compared with patients in the placebo group.
